es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential
Class FlowDrivenActivity

java.lang.Object
  es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential.SimulationObject
      es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential.VariableStoreSimulationObject
          es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential.TimeStampedSimulationObject
              es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential.Activity
                  es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential.FlowDrivenActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
Activity, Debuggable, Describable, FlowDrivenActivity, Identifiable, SimulationObject, VariableStore, VariableStoreSimulationObject, Prioritizable, java.lang.Comparable<SimulationObject>
public class FlowDrivenActivity
extends Activity
implements FlowDrivenActivity

A task which could be carried out by an element and whose duration depends on the finalization of an internal flow. An activity is characterized by its priority, presentiality, and a set of workgroups. Each workgroup represents a combination of resource types required for carrying out the activity, and the duration of the activity when performed with this workgroup.

A normal activity is presential, that is, an element carrying out this activity can't make anything else; and ininterruptible, i.e., once started, the activity keeps its resources until it's finished, even if the resources become unavailable while the activity is being performed. This two characteristics are customizable by means of the Modifier enum type. An activity can be NONPRESENTIAL, when the element can perform other activities while it's performing this one; and INTERRUPTIBLE, when the activity can be interrupted, and later continued, if the resources become unavailable while the activity is being performed.

Author:
Iván Castilla Rodríguez

request

public void request(WorkItem wItem)
Description copied from class: Activity
Requests this activity. Checks if this activity is feasible by the specified work item. If the activity is feasible, carryOut is called; in other case, the work item is added to this activity's queue.

Specified by:
request in class Activity
Parameters:
wItem - Work Item requesting this activity.
